intro: Viguiera parkinsonii, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces showy, cone-shaped flower clusters that range in color from white to pink, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Viguiera parkinsonii thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, making it a suitable choice for xeriscaping in arid regions. Its drought tolerance and low maintenance requirements contribute to its popularity among native plant enthusiasts.
